included.occupation: Graduate student at University of Michigan (MSI)

included.description:
The Bachelor of Arts in Computing (BAC), offered jointly by DePaul's School of New Learning and the College of Computing and Digital Media (CDM), prepared me for a computer and technology-related profession and helped me continue onto the MS HCI graduate program at DePaul's CDM.

SNL's BAC offered me the flexibility and individualized learning approach that is a characteristic of all SNL's programs, while focusing on the latest technology, theory and content provided by CDM.
included.degreeName: Bachelor of Arts - BA in Computing
included.schoolName: DePaul University - School for New Learning

included.description:
The Master of Science in Human-Computer Interaction from DePaul University prepared me to ideate, design, implement, and evaluate computer-based technologies so they are useful and usable for end users. 

This interdisciplinary degree integrates concepts and methods from computer science, graphic design and the social sciences. Drawing upon these concepts and methods, I had a deeper learning of user-centered and participatory design approaches that inform and improve the quality and development of dynamic web sites, mobile apps and desktop applications. 

Practice areas of the program gave emphasis to information and communication technologies ICTs evaluation, exploratory user research, information architecture, interaction design and prototype development.

Led a team of young journalists and radio producers in the creation of national award winning community radio programming

Developed programming for WRTE-FM from conception to broadcast, with strong journalistic integrity and community-centered focus 

Responsible for all programming on WRTE-FM including news, music, and special programs

Managed the production process and scheduling, both of the staff, the programming, and on-air talent training

Conducted demographic research and evaluated results of stationâs target audience

Established relationships with members of the listening community to hear their voice concerning programming objectives

Designed and developed technical strategies for automation of radio station programming, social media presence, musical archival process, and structure of database management
Responsible for maintaining WRTE-FMâs studio equipment and computer network

Assisted the General Manager in daily station operations, FCC compliance, fund raising, grant writing, community out reach and project development
included.title: WRTE FM Program Director & Assistant General Manager

included.description:
I am a User Experience (UX) Researcher working across the entire Nielsen Sales Effectiveness portfolio, supporting 15+ UX designers and their different work streams. Through the use of different user research methodologies, I help identify key client user insights that bring the voice of the customer into our design process.

And as a member of a global, cross-functional design team, I currently:

âª Lead and conduct UX research activities that inform and support Nielsen's Agile UX design and software development process.
âª Participate in strategic research planning: meet with internal clients to identify research questions, help them translate the questions into prioritized research goals & objectives, and then develop a research plan to address identified objectives.
âª Design and conduct research activities per plan, and create and deliver clear and persuasive research findings, including personas, scenarios (user stories), user journey map, and other artifacts.
âª Evangelize research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and oral presentations.
âª Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
âª Work with product leaders, program leaders, and UX leaders to prioritize research opportunities.
âª Promote UX research and design thinking company wide through workshops, development of best practices playbooks and training sessions across different internal company groups.
âª Continue to learn about new tools and methodologies in the UX research and design fields that can help me improve the quality and efficiency of my research.
included.title: User Experience Researcher

included.description:
As a Lead UX Specialist at GfK, I evaluate interfaces in a wide range of products including automotive navigation systems, smart phone and tablet apps, medical equipment, financial software, web sites, paper bills and prescription labels, and more.

I conduct ethnographic research, create wireframes, moderate focus groups, run usability tests, conduct eye-tracking research, run collaborative design workshops with clients, and all of this helps me create final reports and recommendations for our clients.
included.title: Lead User Experience Specialist

included.description:
As an UX consultant I work in developing and conducting qualitative and quantitative research plans to help our clients develop and optimize products such as mobile devices, applications, medical devices, household appliances, consumer electronics, software, websites and in-vehicle technology.

As a User Experience Analyst at User Centric I have worked in projects that have used different research methodologies: user research, user interface design consulting, information architecture, usability testing, user interface evaluations, eye tracking, service design, personas and ethnography.
included.title: User Experience Analyst

included.summary:
My former career as a radio producer and program director helped me fall in love with the interaction environment that radio created. While I was at WRTE I became the accidental techie. It was also my job to keep our station up to date on technologies within our limited budget. I researched, created and maintained different systems for online streaming, databases for music library and scheduling, and help the station set foot into the world of social media.

During that period I fell in love with technology and its social interaction aspect and that guided me to become a student, a career changer, and here I am today, a User Experience researcher with a M.S. In Human Computer Interaction.

I am intellectually curious, constantly expanding learning about new tools and techniques that I can share with my team and the overall User Experience community. I am a curious, fast, eager learner and have a passion and understanding of social interaction.

Areas of Interest: UX research, productivity tools, new technology, and more.
included.headline: User Experience Researcher
